sub_title: Senior Cultural Producer | PhD Researcher | Dramaturg
summary:
I am an experienced strategic project manager and leader with strong motivation to improve lives of individuals and communities through creative work.
My strengths lie in strategic thinking and people management, especially developing diverse partnerships to identify shared priorities and devise out-of-the-box solutions. I have experience devising, articulating, fund-raising, delivering and evaluating projects from the small to large scale.

I have a wide skillset ranging from communications to contract negotiation, strategic development to budget management and reporting. I devise and deliver projects to tight time frames, often with minimal resources and working solo. I have worked in a variety of small and large public sector institutions (including in local government and higher education) and also with micro and solo enterprises, helping companies and individuals to shape, articulate and communicate their ideas to new audiences and funders.

profile_positions.description:
PhD Researcher at the Centre for Dance Research, Coventry University and the Department of Dramaturgy and Musicology, Aarhus University, as part of the 'Mobilizing Dramaturgy' co-tutelle programme. Fully-funded by a studentship, supervised by Prof Susanne Foellmer (Coventry), Prof Peter Boenisch (Aarhus), Dr Marie-Louise Crawley (Coventry) and Siobhan Davies (Coventry/independent).

Through my research I aim to open a dialogue between dance dramaturgy practice and practices of spatial design, especially in the realm of public space (e.g. urban design, landscape architecture). In developing methods of movement-based inquiry, I’m curious to ask: how might an architect/spatial designer and a dance dramaturg work together? What concepts, epistemologies and practices could be offered in exchange to enrich each discipline?

- Presentation at PGR symposium 'Power, Production and Perception: Reconsidering Space and the Built Environment' September 2021. Title: Locating the Body in Space: Investigating the proximities between dance dramaturgy and spatial design
- Presentation at International Federation for Theatre Research, June 2022. Title: 'Nowhere-in-Particular': the problem with dramaturg as cartographer'
- Presentation at European Association for the Study of Theatre and Performance, June 2023. Title: 'Dramaturgy of Practice: a slow togethering' (with Sara Živkovič Kranjc)
- Guest lecturer for BA Dramaturgy, Aarhus University
- PGR representative for Centre for Dance Research, Coventry University, including devising and co-leading the centre's research seminar programme
profile_positions.title: PhD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
I am an independent dance dramaturg and cultural producer with over 10 years’ experience working in the dance and arts development sectors. 

As a dramaturg I have collaborated with artists working in a range of dance forms, from Kathak to screen dance. I also work as a facilitator, recently delivering workshops on movement dramaturgy for the Association of Danish Dramaturgs, London Studio Centre, and Oxford Dance Forum, and regularly facilitating work-in-progress evenings. My practice and professional development has been supported by awards from Arts Council England, Oxford Dance Forum and South East Dance.

I have also directed the ‘Dance & Academia’ project based in Oxford since 2008, convening a number of seminars and conferences engaging movement practitioners and academics in many different disciplines.

In my freelance cultural producing work, my current emphasis is on strategic development, producing and commissioning community-facing arts projects across all art forms, and commissioning public art. Previously I have produced events and productions, led on education and volunteer programmes with young people, and devised and delivered artist professional development programmes.

Clients have included The Mill Banbury, Anjali Dance Company, South East Dance, Scarabeus Aerial Theatre, Junction Dance, OYAP Trust,  Crossover Intergenerational Dance, Oxford Dance Forum, Dancin' Oxford/Oxford City Council, Arts at the Old Fire Station, Metis Theatre.

I was invited as an industry expert to join the assessment panel for the AHRC (Arts & Humanities Research Council) research network fund 'Dance Research Matters' (June 2023). I represented the independent dance sector in South East England on the advocacy group Move South East from 2017-2022 (led by South East Dance and Arts Council England).

www.mirandalaurence.co.uk
profile_positions.title: Independent Dance Dramaturg and Cultural Producer

profile_positions.description: Programme management and documentation for play development research project 'Work in Progress'; Department of Film, Theatre and Television in partnership with South Street, Reading
profile_positions.title: Programme Curator

profile_positions.description:
Researching, developing and implementing an arts strategy for the whole university, programming events and activities, developing collaborations and partnerships, devising and implementing a new public art commissioning strand for the University.

Key Achievements:
- Developed a new public art commissioning policy, setting up a University public art steering group and leading on the development and implementation of public art commissioning briefs, resulting in the commission of new permanent sculpture by Ben Cain and Tina Gverovic
- Developed and produced new outdoor performance commission 'never closer to midnight' by Janine Harrington in association with Reading on Thames festival
- Planned and produced public engagement project commission for school children in association with scientists and the Museum of English Rural Life, led by artist David Lisser
- Planned and produced cross-disciplinary artist and academic exchange project 'On the Fabric of the Human Body' in association with the Health Humanities Research Centre and UoR Special Collections
- Planned and produced three week micro-residency programme for Reading artists in association with jelly and the Architecture Department, culminating in 'Hybrid Practices', a workshop co-organised with staff from Architecture and Fine Arts
- Planned and produced 'Lunchtime Conversations', a three week cross-disciplinary and creative dialogue platform for University staff, students and artists on campus
- Initiated and developed a collaborative project with the Harris Gardens, Institute of Education, Fine Art, Biological Sciences, Access & Outreach, Community Partnership, and external partners to develop a sound walk and children's outdoor education programme
- Led on cross-University communications for the arts strategy (including social media and blog) and managing University placement students
- Responsibility for financial management, strategic planning, and internal advocacy for the arts strategy project
profile_positions.title: Arts Development Officer

profile_positions.description: Writing assessments of Project Grant Applications for the decision panels; monitoring of Cultural Recovery Grant activity.
profile_positions.title: Temporary Assessor

profile_positions.description:
Established in 1977, Fusion is a grassroots social participatory arts organisation delivering high quality meaningful and relevant creative experiences with communities across Oxford and Oxfordshire.
As Deputy Director, I lead on business plan development and organisational management, as well as developing partnerships, devising projects, income generation, and management aspects of the day to day running of the organisation working alongside a small team.

Key achievements:
- Researched and developed a new business plan for the charity
- Oversaw the development of a new marketing strategy, through my role managing our Marketing Manager
- Leading on Fusion Arts' successful proposal and project development as community producer for Wellcome-funded public engagement arts project One Cell at a Time, led by the Wellcome Sanger Institute
- Devised and led on a radical artist support project as part of Fusion Arts Cultural Recovery Fund, supporting four Oxfordshire artists in developing their practice
- Developed plans for and secured a public art commissioning project for Botley Parish Council
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director

profile_positions.description:
I was responsible for programming and managing the participation programme, which included weekly classes in all art forms for children and adults as well as one-off workshops. I also managed the visual arts programme within the gallery space, including programming regular exhibitions and associated activities.
I was responsible for developing and devising community arts projects at Cornerstone and around South Oxfordshire, in partnership with a number of community, voluntary and cultural organisations. I developed and managed public art commissions across the district, funded by S106 contributions as part of the planning process.
I provided support and advice for artists and cultural organisations based in South Oxfordshire, and was a member of the Oxfordshire Arts Partnership.
profile_positions.title: Arts Development Officer

profile_positions.description:
www.ageofcreativity.co.uk

My role was to develop and curate content for a UK-wide website funded by the Baring Foundation to share, celebrate and inspire work in the field of arts and older people.
profile_positions.title: Website Curator, Age of Creativity

company.name: DanceXchange - Make, See & Do Great Dance

profile_positions.description:
I produced David Toole's 'Unlimited International' commission for the Cultural Olympiad, at International Dance Festival Birmingham, South Bank Centre's Unlimited Festival and Baxter Theatre, Cape Town.
I was also lead project manager for the Birmingham City Council funded 'Arts Champions' community liaison project in Sutton Coldfield.
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description: I was responsible for devising, developing and delivering dance focused cultural and community projects for Oxford, including Big Dance South East England 2010, Dancin' Urban young people's holiday dance programme, Moving Oxford young people's dance event, Dance & Older People's steering group. I provided support for dance artists across Oxford, and led on the development and successful fund-raising for Dancin' Oxford festival 2011. As a member of the South East Dance Infrastructure Group I was involved in regional dance development projects and strategy.
profile_positions.title: Dance Officer

volunteer_experiences.description:
Overview of membership and members' communications: administering new members and renewals, compiling and sending regular newsletters, setting up email discussion list, social media activity
Part of working group organising a series of members' events, in particular focusing on virtual dramaturgy
Editor for 'Invisible Diaries' initiative in 2020, 12 weeks of daily publications from dramaturgs worldwide
